Updated review: I have used this app to track my portfolios, back when it was Blockfolio. But now that main feature is stuffed into a sub-menu in favour of the crypto exchange/wallet. As many other reviews have stated, this is A Bad Idea. You can push your exchange/wallet, fine, but relegating the main feature of the app to a sub menu is a big mistake. I didn't feel the need to look for alternatives before, but I do now.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback!  There's no question the text is smaller.  But the new version has many new features users have been asking for.  Multiple portfolios, a markets tab, % based alerts, exchange connections and user accounts, just to name a few.  Check them out--you may like it!

content: The best. Period. UPDATE - The "Profit/Loss" section is INCORRECT and always has been... It should be [(sum of market value + proceeds) - (sum of costs)] / (NET COST)... It currently divides by "Cost". I've done the math - It uses (sum of price paid) as the "Cost" or denominator, when in reality it should be using the NET COST. Ex: If you spend $100 on 10 tokens & sell 5 tokens for $120, it uses $100 as the denominator, but it should use (-$20) ("Net cost" or "Cost basis") PLEASE UPDATE!!!!!
replyContent: Thank you!  ; )
